intro: Sideritis beniboufraiana, commonly known as the Beniboufra sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes. It is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Sideritis beniboufraiana is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
